trans-unit.source: Provides the base class for all `TextWriter` objects used for rendering ASP.NET mobile controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class and its inherited classes provide services and helper methods for adapters to perform rendering.
Creates a new instance of the specified class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
The base writer object.
An object of <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
Adds a resource reference to the given URL, with the optional MIME type for the specified content.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The URL to add the resource reference to.
(Optional) The MIME type of the content.
Begins a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page adapter must call this method before rendering the page, but after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginResponse%2A> method.
An exception is raised if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginFile%2A> method is called more than once.
The unique URL for the file.
The MIME type of the file.
The character set used for the file (usually the same as <xref href="System.Web.HttpResponse.Charset"></xref>).
this method is called more than once.
Begins a response.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> object for the current requesting device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to calling the browser using an <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest>, such as `Page.Request.Browser`.
The <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> object for the current requesting device.
Ends a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Ends a response.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters
Begins a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the character formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters.
If breakAfter is `true`, a break is added after the closing style element.
The first form of the method assumes breakAfter to be `true`.
Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block by using the formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block by using the formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
If breakAfter is true, a break is added after the closing style element.
The first form of the method assumes breakAfter to be `true`.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This overload of <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> adds a break after the closing style element.
The style reference.
Gets a value indicating whether multipart writing is supported.
Default is `false`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if multipart writing is supported; otherwise, `false`.
